scan_table_check.description: The name of a role must not end with "_user". Roles are assigned to users. A role represents a set of access privileges. A role may represent a persona. Or a role is an aggregate of other roles. As a result, a role name ending with "_user" just does not make sense or is redundant information at best. Unfortunately when a new table is created and the user does not specify an existing role to grant access to the new table, the platform creates a new role named after the table and prefixed by "_user". This may lead to new roles without any specific meaning that do not add any value.
scan_table_check.name: CodeSanity - Avoid roles ending with "_user"
scan_table_check.resolution_details: Roles cannot be renamed easily. To fix this finding, define new and/or identify existing personas. Replace any roles ending with "_user" with roles that really represent defined personas. Assign these new roles to all ACLs and other places where access is controlled. Then remove the existing roles ending with "_user".
scan_table_check.short_description: Role names must not end with "_user"
